intro: Parodia orthacantha, commonly known as the "Cactus of the Desert," is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are often covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are typically short-lived but striking. Parodia orthacantha is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it suitable for arid environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts and desert gardens.
